entries.meaning: (dated, Scotland) A quarter (fourth part) used especially as a unit of mass or capacity.
examples: Now, as I learned afterwards [â€¦] that straw is used each day, which carried six bolls, one firlot, and three forpets of grain; that each bunch of straw yielded something less than one peck and three forpets; and that the extent of ground which produced the straw for one day's consumption, was seventy hundredth parts of an acre, Scotch measure.
